Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are electrochemical devices converting the chemical energy into electricity with high efficiency and low pollutant emissions.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Tough very promising, this technology is still in a developing phase, and degradation at the cell/stack level with operating time is still an issue of major concern.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Methods to directly observe degradation modes and to measure their evolution over time are difficult to implement, and indirect performance indicators are adopted, typically related to voltage measurements in long-term tests.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to describe long-term degradation tests, three components of the voltage measurements should be modelled: the smooth decay of voltage over time for each single unit; the variability of voltage decay among units; and the high-frequency small fluctuations of voltage due to experimental noise and lack of fit.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper, we propose an empirical random-effects regression model of polynomial type enabling to evaluate separately these three types of variability.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Point and interval estimates are also derived for some performance measures, such as the mean voltage, the prediction of cell voltage, the reliability function and the cell-to-cell variability in SOFC stacks.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Finally, the proposed methodology is applied to two real case-studies of long-term degradation tests of SOFC stacks.
Titulo: A random-effects model for long-term degradation analysis of solid oxide fuel cells
